column4: i updated my kernel and now my firewall has stopped working (Error with ufw-init) can anyone help
When do you receive that error?
Does the kernel log say anything useful when you run that command?
/var/log/kern.log
Did you try googling: "Error with ufw-init" or the exact error message you are receiving?
Did it actually read "Problem running ufw-init"?
Oh.. Nice of you to mention that piece of info. I assumed that it did nothing...
What does `ufw status` give you?
No, you said the error message was something different that it actually was and that the firewall was "not working". A firewall that is blocking everything is working perfectly.
My point exactly. That's not what is happening at all.
Are you accessing the box via SSH?
Ok. Is your IRC client accessing the server on port 6667?
or even better try `ufw allow 80` followed by `ufw enable` and see if you can access web pages. If you can then the issue is reading the configuration file.
Answering questions is easy. Figuring out what the problem is, that is the hard part. Why don't we try figure out what the hard part is first?
I know that allowing port 80 won't resolve the root cause, but it will help identify it.
Were you able to access web pages?
Yes, but were you able to access web pages?
Did it give you an error when you tried `ufw allow 80`?
I see. Can you pastebin your rules?
I see. You said you had reinstalled ufw. When you did, which command did you use? reinstall and uninstall do not necessarily remove configuration files.
For real?
By complete remove you ofcourse mean apt-get purge ufw
